The textbook used when the course was taught: Simmons, George F. Calculus with Analytic Geometry. 2nd ed. New York, NY: McGraw-Hill, October 1, 1996. ISBN: 9780070576421. For more info see https://ocw.mit.edu/18-01F06. We recommend that you use the OCW Scholar version of the course, which is designed to be accessible without a textbook: https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/mathematics/18-01sc-single-variable-calculus-fall-2010. Best wishes on your studies!

The integral of sinx is pretty easy. If you want to calculate the area from 0 to n times pi, just check if n is odd or even. If its odd then the area is 2, if its even area is equal to zero.
